results.title: Tcap Deficiency in Zebrafish Leads to ROS Production and Mitophagy, and Idebenone Improves its Phenotypes
results.text_hl: Then, we administered @CHEMICAL_Ascorbic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001205 @@@vitamin C@@@, @CHEMICAL_coenzyme_Q10 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C024989 @@@coenzyme Q10@@@, @CHEMICAL_idebenone @CHEMICAL_MESH:C036619 @@@idebenone@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, or @CHEMICAL_Dexamethasone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003907 @@@dexamethasone@@@ to rescue @<m>DISEASE_Muscular_Dystrophy_Limb_Girdle_Type_2G</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C566599 @@@LGMD2G@@@ in @SPECIES_7955 @@@zebrafish@@@.

citations.NLM: Lv X, Zhang R, Xu L, Wang G, Yan C, Lin P.  Tcap Deficiency in Zebrafish Leads to ROS Production and Mitophagy, and Idebenone Improves its Phenotypes Front Cell Dev Biol. 2022;10():836464. PMID: 35372370
